title: New AP + Armor item.
body:
I'm either gonna call it "Haunting Seeker"
or I'm go with my Shurimian theme and call it "Betrayer Cloak" <= In reference to Xerath becuase he stabbed Azir in the back.

Seekers Armgaurd: 1200 Gold in total.
+ 30 Armor
+ 25 AP
*possible + 30*

Haunting Guise: 1485 Gold in total.
+ 25 AP
+ 200 HP
+ 15 Magic Pen *Unique*

Seekers + Haunting + 500 Gold. 3185 Gold in total.
+ 65 AP
+ 45 Armor
+ 300 HP
+ 20 Magic Pen *Unigue*
New *Unique* Passive.
Landing Spells Grants you Bonus movespeed for a few seconds.
Stacks 3 times. (lets say 5% so it can beceome 15% bonus move speed.)

Feel free to help me discuss this.
In a complaint I submitted to riot *Blah blah conversations* "Moonsugar" (Props to him for giving me the idea)
said there was a lack of AP + Armor items. Which I agree, there is only one and that's {{item:3157}} .

As much as the 3 second invul is good, what if you still die too quickly or would like more armor with yo AP.
So what does everyone think? 

P.S. @Riot, I can make any item you desire. Test my metal, I dare you.

replies.body:
Feels too strong of an item, and I can see some synergies that would break it.
(Cassiopeia)

Tell me about the Synergies then?
Because to me it just becomes one of those Big AP items, and thus they might have to sacrifice another item just to have this one.
And if people are cleaver - It rewards picks.
And if you get focused- doesn't.

Late reply cause I don't really use boards.
I could see this item being a bit strong on AP bruiser type champions, namely Sejuani.
Also wouldn't consider it a "big ap item" since it builds out of small components.

Would also like to note you have a few typos here and there, "cleaver", "armgaurd" as well as some wrong information "possible +30" should be "possible +15"

Shhhh Im usually really tired when im on here.
Also these items cost just as much as Sheen, phage and so on. Yet those small components make a big item.
Don't Diss the little guys.

A) 
>Landing Spells Grants you Bonus movespeed for a few seconds.
Stacks 3 times. (lets say 5% so it can beceome 15% bonus move speed.)

This doesn't suit the two items you put together, not to mention this gives the item way too much gold stats in value (consider that liandry's is less M-Pen, no armor, a worse passive and less AP for only 285 gold less.).

B) if you need armor that bad, go to Iceborn Gauntlet, that has plenty of amazing stats (and i'm offended that even a rioter forgot this item)

The move is in reference to something. 
I thought that 1 thing some APC's need is Move speed. -*Like Xerath as he has very little of that*

And the gold I did was a simple +500 as the item grants over 50 AP -*Most items*
And the still more Defense + Pen.

However as I should have mentions at the bottom of it.
My first idea of its passive was another stacking system (Like the Seeker)
Where you would get + 5 HP and + 1 Pen that stacks 20 times.
Granting another 100 HP and 20 Pen (I suppose then it might justify the Gold Value)

Iceborn is a great Item, as it grants AP-Mana-Armor.
Plus its Sheen effect and so on.

How ever, I would not get that Item on Azir, the Betrayer *Cough* I mean Xerath. Or some other AP Carries.
As that Item suits more Ekko, Diana.

Gold value of your hypothetical item:

+ 65 AP: 1410
+ 45 Armor: 900
+ 300 HP: 800
+ 20 Magic Pen Unique: 680

Pre passive value: 3790

Passive, 5% movespeed per stack: 211 per stack

Full stacked passive value: 4423 gold

So not only is it gold efficent without stacks, it becomes rediculous with stacks.

Also iceborn is underrated on mages, if your that far behind and need that much armor, there is nothing wrong with an iceborn.

I don't know how you do Gold value on things its 3 am, No real maths for me.

and once again tho, if your far behind why go for an item that you cant make (some) of it out?
Why not another item that can Grant Armor and its other things while also still being useful all the time.

I might have to start learning this Gold to Stat value. 
Especially if I want to create an item that Gold Worthy and fair.

Wiki and half assing a calculator.

>and once again tho, if your far behind why go for an item that you cant make (some) of it out?

Have you ever used a Iceborn on a mage?
Only on Melee Mages *Like Ekko and Diana again* But never on ranged. Every time I do get it on them I feel like its not being worthy and I end up not ever getting it again.
